Thanks for the really excellent bug report by the way: clear reproduction steps, helpful speculation on where to look :)

The issue can be observed in the [official example](https://bevyengine.org/examples/animation/animated-fox/) by repeatedly pressing enter fast:
![example](https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/assets/29227697/6a6cf300-e41c-4492-b4ee-6f4994ac8694)

issue.title: Fix repeated animation transition bug

labels.name: S-Ready-For-Final-Review
labels.description: This PR has been approved by the community. It's ready for a maintainer to consider merging it

labels.name: A-Animation
labels.description: Make things move and change over time

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective

Fixes #13910

When a transition is over, the animation is stopped. There was a race condition; if an animation was started while it also had an active transition, the transition ending would then incorrectly stop the newly added animation.

## Solution

When starting an animation, cancel any previous transition for the same animation.

## Testing

The changes were tested manually, mainly by using the `animated_fox` example. I also tested with changes from https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/13909.

I'd like to have an unit test for this as well, but it seems quite complex to do, as I'm not sure how I would detect an incorrectly paused animation.

Reviewers can follow the instructions in #13910 to reproduce.

Tested on macos 14.4 (M3 processor) Should be platform-independent, though.

issue.title: AnimationTransitions: Quickly Change from `a` to `b`, then back to `a`will freeze the animation

labels.name: S-Duplicate
labels.description: This issue or PR already exists

labels.name: A-Animation
labels.description: Make things move and change over time

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
bevy 0.14

Quickly Change the animation from `a` to `b`, then back to `a`will stop the animation

The official example animation/animated_fox is enough to show this issue.

Recreating the issue:

in line 176
https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/blob/b231ebbc195e12ae47616748e532c8dbc24218dd/examples/animation/animated_fox.rs#L176

```rust
*current_animation = (*current_animation + 1) % animations.animations.len();

transitions
    .play(
        &mut player,
        animations.animations[*current_animation],
        Duration::from_millis(250),
    )
    .repeat();
```
change it to 
```rust
*current_animation = (*current_animation + 1) % 2;

// the same
```
then run the example, quickly hit "Enter" multiple times, and you'll see the animation get stuck. 

Not just the example. In fact I got this issue in my own project, and I think it's a bevy bug, and then I triggered it easily in the fox example.

I think it's fatal, because in my situation, it's easily triggered when my PC is chaning its walking direction. Because there will be a moment the speed is zero. So, speed 1, 0, -1 will correspond to Walk, idle, Walk, and this is exactly the case.

issue.title: the 0.14.1 branch release still has  the Animation issue (but the 0.14.1 tag hasn't)

labels.name: S-Needs-Triage
labels.description: This issue needs to be labelled

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
Related to 
https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/14411/files#diff-2b9739c060b50101f9ab4e0bab00c34bcc80201a52ab13315b08a649765eb45f

https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/issues/13910

and my issue
https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/issues/14548


Why is it still not fixed in 0.14.1?

I still see 

```
 self.main_animation = Some(new_animation);
player.start(new_animation)
```

instead of 

```
self.transitions
    .retain(|transition| transition.animation != new_animation);

player.start(new_animation)
```

I can see it in the source code
https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/blob/7c80ae73133f9866f2ed477ce9922c83fc3fe1cc/crates/bevy_animation/src/transition.rs#L97

but, when I use it in my code, in the fetched file

/Users/my_user_name/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/bevy_animation-0.14.1/src/transition.rs

I can still see the old code instead of new.

Why?? I'm confused.

Can somebody confirm this? The fetched code from crates.io isn't the same as the github code.
